alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Northumberland (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 2:29PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL NORTHUMBERLAND AND SOUTHEASTERN COLUMBIA COUNTIES THROUGH 300 PM EDT... At 229 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mount Carmel, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mount Carmel, Kulpmont, Aristes, Numidia, Wilburton Number One, Slabtown, Wilburton Number Two, Marion Heights and Centralia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central Pennsylvania.
